acai.definition: The small edible blackish-purple berries of a South American palm tree

bean.definition: An edible seed, typically kidney-shaped, growing in long pods on certain leguminous plants.

beef.definition: The flesh of a cow, bull, or ox, used as food.

beet.definition: A herbaceous plant widely cultivated as a source of food for humans and livestock, and for processing into sugar. Some varieties are grown for their leaves and some for their large nutritious root.

cake.definition: An item of soft, sweet food made from a mixture of flour, shortening, eggs, sugar, and other ingredients, baked and often decorated.

clam.definition: A marine bivalve mollusk with shells of equal size.

corn.definition: a North American cereal plant that yields large grains, or kernels, set in rows on a cob. Its many varieties yield numerous products, highly valued for both human and livestock consumption

dill.definition: An aromatic annual herb of the parsley family, with fine blue-green leaves and yellow flowers. The leaves and seeds of dill are used for flavoring and for medicinal purposes

feta.definition: White salty Bulgarian cheese made from the milk of ewes or goats.

fish.definition: A limbless cold-blooded vertebrate animal with gills and fins and living wholly in water.

kiwi.definition: The edible fruit of a Chinese gooseberry having a fuzzy brown skin and slightly acidic typically green flesh

mint.definition: An aromatic plant native to temperate regions of the Old World, several kinds of which are used as culinary herbs.

oreo.definition: A brand of chocolate sandwich cookie with a creamy white filling.

pear.definition: A yellowish- or brownish-green edible fruit that is typically narrow at the stalk and wider toward the base, with sweet, slightly gritty flesh.

salt.definition: A white crystalline substance that gives seawater its characteristic taste and is used for seasoning or preserving food.

soup.definition: A liquid dish, typically made by boiling meat, fish, or vegetables, etc., in stock or water.

taco.definition: A Mexican dish consisting of a fried tortilla, typically folded, filled with various mixtures, such as seasoned meat, beans, lettuce, and tomatoes

tofu.definition: Curd made from mashed soybeans, used chiefly in Asian and vegetarian cooking.

tart.definition: An open pastry case containing a filling.

koala.definition: A bearlike arboreal Australian marsupial that has thick gray fur and feeds on eucalyptus leaves

horse.definition: A large plant-eating domesticated mammal with solid hoofs and a flowing mane and tail, used for riding, racing, and to carry and pull loads.

zebra.definition: An African wild horse with black-and-white stripes and an erect mane

rihno.definition: massive powerful herbivorous odd-toed ungulate of southeast Asia and Africa having very thick skin and one or two horns on the snout

tiger.definition: A very large solitary cat with a yellow-brown coat striped with black, native to the forests of Asia but becoming increasingly rare.

hippo.definition: Aa large heavy African animal with thick dark skin and short legs that lives in rivers and lakes

mouse.definition: A small rodent that typically has a pointed snout, relatively large ears and eyes, and a long tail.

sheep.definition: A domesticated ruminant animal with a thick woolly coat and (typically only in the male) curving horns. It is kept in flocks for its wool or meat, and is proverbial for its tendency to follow others in the flock

camel.definition: A large, long-necked ungulate mammal of arid country, with long slender legs, broad cushioned feet, and either one or two humps on the back. Camels can survive for long periods without food or drink, chiefly by using up the fat reserves in their humps

llama.definition: A domesticated pack animal of the camel family found in the Andes, valued for its soft woolly fleece.

bison.definition: A humpbacked shaggy-haired wild ox native to North America and Europe

hyena.definition: A doglike African mammal with forelimbs that are longer than the hind limbs and an erect mane. Hyenas are noted as scavengers but most are also effective hunters

dingo.definition: A wild or half-domesticated dog with a sandy-colored coat, found in Australia.

lion.definition: A large heavily built social cat (Panthera leo) of open or rocky areas chiefly of sub-Saharan Africa

wofl.definition: A wild carnivorous mammal of the dog family, living and hunting in packs. It is native to both Eurasia and North America, but has been widely exterminated

bear.definition: A large, heavy mammal that walks on the soles of its feet, having thick fur and a very short tail. Bears are related to the dog family but most species are omnivorous.

deer.definition: A hoofed grazing or browsing animal, with branched bony antlers that are shed annually and typically borne only by the male

goat.definition: A farm animal or a wild animal that is about the size of a sheep with horns, and hairs on their chin which resemble a beard

duck.definition: A waterbird with a broad blunt bill, short legs, webbed feet, and a waddling gait

seal.definition: A fish-eating aquatic mammal with a streamlined body and feet developed as flippers, that returns to land to breed or rest

bias.definition: Prejudice in favor of or against one thing, person, or group compared with another, usually in a way considered to be unfair.

bird.definition: A warm-blooded egg-laying vertebrate distinguished by the possession of feathers, wings, and a beak and (typically) by being able to fly.

care.definition: The provision of what is necessary for the health, welfare, maintenance, and protection of someone or something.

chair.definition: A separate seat for one person, typically with a back and four legs.

coat.definition: An outer garment worn outdoors, having sleeves and typically extending below the hips.

cost.definition: Require the payment of (a specified sum of money) before it can be acquired or done.

cure.definition: Relieve (a person or animal) of the symptoms of a disease or condition.

cusp.definition: a point of transition between two states.

dial.definition: Call (a phone number) by turning a disk with numbered holes or using a keypad or touchscreen.

load.definition: A heavy or bulky thing that is being carried or is about to be carried.

long.definition: measuring a great distance from end to end.

dust.definition: Fine, dry powder consisting of tiny particles of earth or waste matter lying on the ground or on surfaces or carried in the air

hair.definition: Any of the fine threadlike strands growing from the skin of humans, mammals, and some other animals

jacket.definition: An outer garment extending either to the waist or the hips, typically having sleeves and a fastening down the front.

fork.definition: An implement with two or more prongs used for lifting food to the mouth or holding it when cutting

jeans.definition: Hard-wearing trousers made of denim or other cotton fabric, for informal wear

knife.definition: An instrument composed of a blade fixed into a handle, used for cutting or as a weapon

moon.definition: The natural satellite of the earth, visible (chiefly at night) by reflected light from the sun.

more.definition: A greater or additional amount of something.

part.definition: A piece or segment of something such as an object, activity, or period of time, which combined with other pieces makes up the whole

sheet.definition: A large rectangular piece of cotton or other fabric, used on a bed to cover the mattress and as a layer beneath blankets when these are used

broccoli.definition: A cultivated variety of cabbage bearing heads of green or purplish flower buds that are eaten as a vegetable.

chestnut.definition: A glossy brown nut that may be roasted and eaten

chickpea.definition: A round yellowish seed, used widely as food

eggplant.definition: The purple egg-shaped fruit of a tropical Old World plant, which is eaten as a vegetable.

hazelnut.definition: A round brown hard-shelled treenut that is edible

honeydew.definition: a melon of a variety with smooth pale skin and sweet green flesh.

mulberry.definition: A small deciduous tree with broad leaves, native to East Asia and long cultivated elsewhere.

zucchini.definition: A green variety of smooth-skinned summer squash.

coconut.definition: The large, oval, brown seed of a tropical palm, consisting of a hard shell lined with edible white flesh and containing a clear liquid. It grows inside a woody husk, surrounded by fiber.

parsnip.definition: A long tapering cream-colored root with a sweet flavor

brisket.definition: A meat cut from the breast of an animal, typically a cow

brownie.definition: A small square of rich chocolate cake, typically containing nuts.

lasagna.definition: A baked Italian dish consisting of wide strips of pasta cooked and layered with meat or vegetables, cheese, and tomato sauce.

banana.definition: A long curved fruit which grows in clusters and has soft pulpy flesh and yellow skin when ripe.

almond.definition: the oval edible nutlike seed (kernel) of a tree, growing in a woody shell, widely used as food.

ginger.definition: A hot, fragrant spice made from the rhizome of a plant, which may be chopped or powdered for cooking, preserved in syrup, or candied.

muffin.definition: A small domed cake or quick bread made from batter or dough.

oyster.definition: Any of a number of bivalve mollusks with rough irregular shells. Several kinds are eaten (especially raw) as a delicacy and may be farmed for food or pearls.

samosa.definition: A triangular savory pastry fried in ghee or oil, containing spiced vegetables or meat.

yogurt.definition: A semisolid food prepared from milk fermented by added bacteria, often sweetened and flavored.

leopard.definition: A large, solitary cat that has a yellowish-brown or brown coat with black spots and usually hunts at night, widespread in the forests of Africa and southern Asia.

cheetah.definition: A large spotted cat found in Africa and parts of Asia. It is the fastest animal on land

penguin.definition: A large flightless seabird of the southern hemisphere, with black upper parts and white underparts and wings developed into flippers for swimming under water.

giraffe.definition: A large African mammal with a very long neck and forelegs, having a coat patterned with brown patches separated by lighter lines. It is the tallest living animal.

octopus.definition: A cephalopod mollusc with eight sucker-bearing arms, a soft body, strong beaklike jaws, and no internal shell.

dolphin.definition: A small gregarious toothed whale that typically has a beaklike snout and a curved fin on the back. Dolphins have become well known for their sociable nature and high intelligence.

hamster.definition: A solitary burrowing rodent with a short tail and large cheek pouches for carrying food, native to Europe and northern Asia

peacock.definition: A large male bird with long blue and green tail feathers that it can spread out like a fan

raccoon.definition: A grayish-brown American mammal that has a foxlike face with a black mask and a ringed tail.

jaguar.definition: A large heavily built cat that has a yellowish-brown coat with black spots, found mainly in the dense forests of Central and South America

parrot.definition: A bird, often vividly colored, with a short down-curved hooked bill, grasping feet, and a raucous voice, found especially in the tropics and feeding on fruits and seeds. Many are popular as cage birds, and some are able to mimic the human voice

donkey.definition: A domesticated hoofed mammal of the horse family with long ears and a braying call, used as a beast of burden; an ass

badger.definition: A heavily built omnivorous nocturnal mammal of the weasel family, typically having a gray and black coat

beaver.definition: A large semiaquatic broad-tailed rodent that is native to North America and northern Eurasia. It is noted for its habit of gnawing through tree trunks to fell the trees in order to feed on the bark and build dams

falcon.definition: A bird of prey with long pointed wings and a notched beak, typically catching prey by diving on it from above

bobcat.definition: A small North American cat species with a barred and spotted coat and a short tail

alpaca.definition: A long-haired domesticated South American mammal related to the llama, valued for its wool

turtle.definition: A slow-moving reptile, enclosed in a scaly or leathery domed shell into which it can retract its head and thick legs

monkey.definition: A small to medium-sized primate that typically has a long tail, most kinds of which live in trees in tropical countries.

weasle.definition: A small, slender, carnivorous mammal related to, but generally smaller than, the stoat

apartment.definition: A suite of rooms forming one residence, typically in a building containing a number of these

banish.definition: Send (someone) away from a country or place as an official punishment

baseball.definition: A ball game played between two teams of nine on a field with a diamond-shaped circuit of four bases. It is played chiefly in the US, Canada, Latin America, and East Asia

basement.definition: The floor of a building which is partly or entirely below ground level

basket.definition: A container used to hold or carry things, typically made from interwoven strips of cane or wire

biology.definition: The study of living organisms, divided into many specialized fields that cover their morphology, physiology, anatomy, behavior, origin, and distribution

boundary.definition: A line that marks the limits of an area; a dividing line

careless.definition: Not giving sufficient attention or thought to avoiding harm or errors

chemistry.definition: The branch of science that deals with the identification of the substances of which matter is composed; the investigation of their properties and the ways in which they interact, combine, and change; and the use of these processes to form new substances

college.definition: An educational institution or establishment, in particular one providing higher education or specialized professional or vocational training

crispy.definition: (of food, typically cooked food) having a pleasingly firm, dry, and brittle surface or texture

describe.definition: Give an account in words of (someone or something), including all the relevant characteristics, qualities, or events

educate.definition: Give intellectual, moral, and social instruction to (someone, especially a child), typically at a school or university

emphasis.definition: Special importance, value, or prominence given to something

gossip.definition: Casual or unconstrained conversation or reports about other people, typically involving details that are not confirmed as being true

install.definition: Place or fix (equipment or machinery) in position ready for use

lawyer.definition: A person who practices or studies law; an attorney or a counselor

margin.definition: The edge or border of something

partner.definition: Either of a pair of people engaged together in the same activity

pillow.definition: A rectangular cloth bag stuffed with feathers, foam rubber, or other soft materials, used to support the head when lying down

student.definition: A person who is studying at a school or college

teacher.definition: A person who teaches, especially in a school

strawberry.definition: a sweet soft red fruit with a seed-studded surface

cantaloupe.definition: A small round melon of a variety with orange flesh and ribbed skin

gooseberry.definition: A round edible yellowish-green or reddish berry with a thin translucent hairy skin

grapefruit.definition: A large round yellow citrus fruit with an acid juicy pulp.

watermelon.definition: The large fruit of a plant of the gourd family, with smooth green skin, red pulp, and watery juice.

chanterelle.definition: an edible woodland mushroom with a yellow funnel-shaped cap and a faint smell of apricots, found in both Eurasia and North America.

boysenberry.definition: A large red edible fruit resembling a blackberry

cauliflower.definition: A cabbage of a variety which bears a large immature flower head of small creamy-white flower buds.

horseradish.definition: A European plant of the cabbage family with long leaves like those of the dock, grown for its pungent edible root.

clementine.definition: A tangerine of a deep orange-red North African variety which is grown around the Mediterranean and in South Africa.

cheesecake.definition: A kind of rich dessert cake made with cream and soft cheese on a graham cracker, cookie, or pastry crust, typically topped with a fruit sauce.

mayonnaise.definition: A thick creamy dressing consisting of egg yolks beaten with oil and vinegar and seasoned.

mozzarella.definition: a mild, semisoft white Italian cheese, often used in Italian cooking as a melted topping, especially on pizzas

gingerbread.definition: A cake made with molasses and flavored with ginger.

marshmallow.definition: A soft, chewy confection made with sugar and gelatin.

pumpernickel.definition: A typically dense, slightly sweet rye bread traditionally made with sourdough starter and coarsely ground rye.

mortadella.definition: A baked Italian dish consisting of wide strips of pasta cooked and layered with meat or vegetables, cheese, and tomato sauce.

elderberry.definition: The bluish-black or red berry of a bush, used especially for making jelly or wine

dragonfruit.definition: A  large usually oval to oblong fruit of any of several erect, sprawling, or vining cacti (as of the genera Selenicereus, Hylocereus, or Sternocereus) that has leathery skin with prominent scaly spikes and juicy flesh

elephant.definition: The largest living land animal, characterized by its long trunk (elongated upper lip and nose), columnar legs, and huge head with temporal glands and wide, flat ears

kangaroo.definition: A large plant-eating marsupial with a long powerful tail and strongly developed hind limbs that enable it to travel by leaping, found only in Australia and New Guinea

squirrel.definition: An agile tree-dwelling rodent with a bushy tail, typically feeding on nuts and seeds

chipmunk.definition: A burrowing ground squirrel with cheek pouches and light and dark stripes running down the body, found in North America and northern Eurasia

hedgehog.definition: A small nocturnal Old World mammal with a spiny coat and short legs, able to roll itself into a ball for defense

seahorse.definition: A small sea fish that swims in a vertical position and has a head that looks like the head of a horse

flamingo.definition: A large pink bird with long thin legs and a long neck, that lives near water in warm countries

reindeer.definition: a large deer with long antlers (= hard parts on the head that are like branches), that lives in cold northern regions

mongoose.definition: A small carnivorous mammal with a long body and tail and a grizzled or banded coat, native to Africa and Asia.

alligator.definition: A large semiaquatic reptile similar to a crocodile but with a broader and shorter head, native to the Americas and China.

crocodile.definition: A large predatory semiaquatic reptile with long jaws, long tail, short legs, and a horny textured skin, using submersion and stealth to approach prey unseen.

albatross.definition: A large white ocean bird that has very long wings.

chinchilla.definition: A small South American rodent with soft gray fur and a long bushy tail

salamander.definition: A lizard-like amphibian with an elongated body and tail and short limbs, once thought able to endure fire.

labradoodle.definition: A dog that is bred as a cross between a Labrador and a poodle

butterfly.definition: A flying insect with a long thin body and four large, usually brightly colored, wings

bumblebee.definition: A large bee covered with small hairs that makes a loud noise as it flies

grasshopper.definition: An insect with long back legs, that can jump very high and that makes a sound with its legs

hummingbird.definition: A small brightly coloured bird that lives in warm countries and that can stay in one place in the air by beating its wings very fast, making a continuous low sound

woodpecker.definition: A bird with a long beak that it uses to make holes in trees when it is looking for insects to eat

background.definition: The area or scenery behind the main object of contemplation, especially when perceived as a framework for it

chickenpox.definition: An infectious disease causing a mild fever and a rash of itchy inflamed blisters. It is caused by the herpes zoster virus and mainly affects children, who are afterward usually immune

chimpanzee.definition: A great ape with large ears, mainly black coloration, and lighter skin on the face, native to the forests of western and central Africa. Chimpanzees show advanced behavior such as the making and using of tools

circumstances.definition: Facts or conditions connected with or relevant to an event or action

condescending.definition: Having or showing a feeling of patronizing superiority

constitution.definition: A body of fundamental principles or established precedents according to which a state or other organization is acknowledged to be governed

demonstration.definition: The action or process of showing the existence or truth of something by giving proof or evidence

deoxidizer.definition: Any agent that reduces the oxygen content of a material

distinguish.definition: Recognize or treat (someone or something) as different

environment.definition: The surroundings or conditions in which a person, animal, or plant lives or operates

equivalent.definition: Equal in value, amount, function, meaning, etc

fabrication.definition: The action or process of manufacturing or inventing something

friendship.definition: The emotions or conduct of close people; the state of being close people

generosity.definition: The quality or fact of being plentiful or large

hypothesis.definition: A supposition or proposed explanation made on the basis of limited evidence as a starting point for further investigation

identifiers.definition: Sequences of characters used to identify or refer to a program or an element, such as a variable or a set of data, within it

international.definition: Existing, occurring, or carried on between two or more nations

juxtaposition.definition: The fact of two things being seen or placed close together with contrasting effect

mesmerizing.definition: Capturing one's complete attention as if by magic

retrospective.definition: Looking back on or dealing with past events or situations

vocabulary.definition: Words used on a particular occasion or in a particular sphere
